Full house at the Hospitality Day in Rimini where we talked about how Facebook can help SMBs in the travel industry succeed.
Creating a fast connection with your desired audience, catching their attention in the first few seconds, is key and Facebook the perfect platform to achieve that.
For many, having a job at BlackRock or J.P. Morgan is the ultimate dream.
And leaving a stable job, with good pay might seem outright crazy.
But there are people out there crazy enough to take the risk, in order to follow their passion!
I‚Äôm fortunate enough to call two of those ‚Äúcrazy‚Äù people my friends.
Adrian Lai & Anthony Wong have both recently left their IB jobs to follow their passion for FinTech and to create something of their own.
They‚Äôve recently founded Orichal Partners, a cryptocurrency hedge fund and blockchain advisory service in Hong Kong.
Bringing their years of experience in traditional financial services as well as their passion and expertise in cryptos & blockchain to provide superior service to clients.
I‚Äôd highly recommend anyone looking for advisory/investment services in crypto to check them out.
While some may say you‚Äôre crazy, I can only say I'm proud and inspired by you both!
I want to wish the best of luck to Orichal Partners, and here‚Äôs to your continued success!
I want to hear about risks you've taken in your life/career.
Please share in the comments below üëáüèº

E-Commerce Business Developer, specialised in 5 product categories:- Beauty- Home- Groceries- Beer Wine & Spirits- PetsActivities:‚Ä¢ Identify, prospect and reach out to new vendors, analyze their potential for Amazon;‚Ä¢ Recruit and drive new vendors through all the on-boarding phases and make their selection available on the Amazon platform. Master Amazon‚Äôs internal tools and train vendors on how to use these tools;‚Ä¢ Be a business consultant to new vendors and provide insights and advice for them, dealing with different business profiles and sectors;‚Ä¢ Plan, conduct, deliver and report analyses to understand the performance of recruited vendors;‚Ä¢ Help to develop and improve recruiting and on-boarding processes, assist in removing any technical blockers and identifying technical improvement areas.

As part of the International Consultancy Project, run every year at the Rotterdam School of Management, I joined a team of international students to work intensively on a project, carried out for OnTopic, a startup company which developed a software tool that supports professionalizing meetings.Embarked on this project to understand what consultants do on a day-to-day basis. Explored how to analyze organizational problems, how to craft solutions and recommendations and  develop a professional client relationship, but most of all the ability to ask the right questions!‚û§ Aim of the project: Define an actionable commercial strategy for international expansion. "Market Entry Strategy"

I joined the D'Avino Mixers' team as an intern, to manage and support the digital and social media strategy for one of the main exhibitions in the construction industry, the Intermat, in Paris.This experience helped me learning more about myself in a team environment of an SMB, I improved my communication and listening skills and developed a more conscious and results-driven work ethic. I found key the personal exposure I had during the event, the face-to-face customer interaction made me aware of the importance of a well-managed customer relationship.‚ú¶ Main takeways: Be prepared. Make sure you know more than your customers!;Listen and listen more. Focus on what people say and understand their priorities;Observe and absorb;Help your teammates;Responsibilities:‚ñ∏ Organisation of the digital strategy during internal & external company events;‚ñ∏ Planned, lead, and executed brand awareness campaigns and programs across digital media (emailing campaigns, updating all the current web pages of the brand, traffic analysis);‚ñ∏ Innovated trade-show‚Äôs customer engagement, generating sales leads & driving ‚Ç¨100K+ in revenue; ‚ñ∏ Community management: Implemented editorial content for Twitter, Youtube & LinkedIn;‚ñ∏ Empowered sales team with support on sales strategies and client recommendations based on robust analysis of user and customer behaviour;‚ñ∏ Customer relationship management;

I joined Impatto Magazine for two reasons, the first being my willingness to be productive out of the academic environment and the second being the startup life, plus their great team culture, an inspiration and motivation for a young student like me, that wanted to have a real impact on his surroundings.I learned faster than ever before. My core was to help the company growing and I was involved in every decision regarding marketing, defining the product roadmap or working on the social media strategy. This strengthen my innate entrepreneurial spirit and helped me develop my practical sense and interpersonal skills.‚ú¶ Main takeaway:Be proactive. It means anticipating problems, seeking new solutions and doing your best.Responsibilities:‚ñ∏ Build relationships with clients and agencies‚ñ∏ Identify, develop and qualify new advertiser sales leads ‚ñ∏ Execute and deliver high-quality responses to RFPs‚ñ∏ Engage and strategize with colleagues to develop new and innovative advertising products‚ñ∏ Create professional and actionable sales presentations‚ñ∏ Competitive Intelligence‚ñ∏ Exceed pricing targets and sales goals

I‚Äôve known Sujay thanks to our experience at IE Business School. We worked closely on a consulting project, based on the design thinking methodology, to reconsider the role of museums in this new digital era. Positive and collaborative member, Sujay has been key to achieve our maximum potential as a team, since he was focused, calm and committed, giving me the perception to have someone whom I could count on. One of his main strength is definitely the way he's able to listen to what others say, absorb and give critical opinions on the matter, pushing forward the solution generation process. Hana Milanov
Professor of Entrepreneurship
September 19, 2015, Adriano reported directly to Hana

Inspiring mentor. Hana has been my teacher for the 'entrepreneuring workshop' at IE Business School.She brought us to another reasoning level that our class didn't immediately perceived, but her ability consisted in giving us the right tools and hints to finally understand it.Last question she asked us was about the feeling we were having at the end of the workshop, and the first thing that came to my mind was "provoked". Something happened, like a change of perspectives, she displayed us a new way to approach issues and different situations by giving us the opportunity to be open to learn and to do an hands-on experience.Sharp, patient, always smiling, traits that makes her the teacher you wish you had.

summary: Your vision of where or who you want to be is the greatest asset you have. Without having a goal it's difficult to score. - Paul ArdenThe one quote inspiring my everyday life and my career's management.Proud Italian by birth and citizen of the world by choice. As I lived and studied in 4 different countries, Italy, England, Spain and Holland I ended up enlarging my network, broadening my horizons andbecoming a better version of myself. Resilience, tolerance and self-awareness are the personal traits, I feel I refined the most during these years, always on the go, constantly changing environment and adapting to different realities. I am inspired by great visions, leaders as makers and human capital development, I believe in actions that count and in a visible impact of my future contribution.My areas of expertise cover digital business, marketing & advertising management, businessdevelopment, digital marketing, social media strategy, startups, small & medium businesses (SMBs).About my role as team member, after 50+ projects, run with 40+ nationalities, all the constructive conflicts and discussions I have been through, encouraged me to be open to criticism, to compromise when the situation calls for it and to be assertive when necessary. I discovered a natural instinct to take responsibility and initiative and all the good and bad that comes with them.My continue quest for feedbacks, helped me in this learning process. If you were to ask my colleagues, I‚Äôm confident they‚Äôd describe me as a skilful networker, empathetic motivator, powerful communicator and good friend; at the same time, being Italian I turn out to be talkative, straightforward and a bit demanding, so still a lot to work on there!Where do I imagine myself in 5 years? I might confess it's a bit hard to envision, or maybe it's just the neapolitan superstition that comes into play. I can only anticipate that who I will be working with, will be as much as important as what I will do.
